statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Columbia 73, Harvard 64
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- John Baumann had 20 points, 12 rebounds and three steals as Columbia came back from a nine point, second-half deficit to hand Harvard its seventh straight loss 73-64 on Saturday night. Drew Housman led the Crimson with 25 points, while Evan Harris added 14 points. Baumann scored 12 points as Columbia outscored Harvard 25-17 over the last 11:08. Ben Nwachukwu had eight points in the last eight minutes and finished with 16 points and three blocks. Mack Montgomery had 13 points on 4-of-4 shooting for Columbia, which won its fourth straight. Columbia (12-11, 5-3 Ivy League) had nine offensive rebounds in the second half, outrebounding the Crimson 24-16 in the half and 36-32 overall. Harvard shot 43 percent from the floor and 33 percent from 3-point range in the first half to take a 34-29 halftime lead. But the Crimson (6-18, 1-7) made just 30 percent from the field and 2-of-11 from beyond the arc in the second half. The Crimson made just one shot over a 10-minute span in the first half before scoring 10 points in the last 3:43, capped by Housman's 3-pointer at the buzzer.
